gurmukhi: hY Pyr cwr idswn mY sB jIq kY iCqpwl ]
transliteration: Hai Pher Chaar Disaan Mai Sabh Jeet Kai Chhitpaal||
translation: All the king were conquered by sending the horse in all the four directions.

gurmukhi: bwj myD kirE spUrn Aim`q j`g irswl ]
transliteration: Baaj Medh Kario Sapooran Amitt Jagg Risaal||
translation: The horse-sacrifice was thus completed, it is very great and marvelous in the world.

gurmukhi: BwNq BwNq Anyk dwn su dIjIAih idjrwj ]
transliteration: Bhaant Bhaant Anek Daan Su Deejeeah(i) Dijraaj||||
translation: Various types of materials were given to the Brahmins in charity.
Also many types of silken clothes, horses and great elephant.12.153.

gurmukhi: Anyk dwn dIey idjwnn Aim`q drb Apwr ]
transliteration: Anek Daan Deee Dijaanan Amitt Darab Apaar||
translation: Many gifts and unaccountable wealth was given in charity to innumerable Brahmins.

gurmukhi: hIr cIr ptMbrwid suvrn ky bhu Bwr ]
transliteration: Heer Cheer Patanbraadh Suvaran Ke Bahu Bhaar||
translation: Including diamonds, common clothes, silken clothes and many loads of gold.

gurmukhi: dust pust qRsy sBY QrhirE suin igrrwie ]
transliteration: Dousat Pousat Trase Sabhai Thar-hario Soun(i) Gir-raae||
translation: All the great enemies were horrified and even Sumeru, the king of mountain trembled on listening the details of charity.

gurmukhi: kwit kwit n dY d?i?jY niRp bwNt bwNt lutwie ]13]154]
transliteration: Kaattee Kaat(i) Na Dai Dvijai Nrip Baant Baant Loutaae||13||154||
translation: Fearing that the Chief Sovereign may not cut him into bits and then distribute the bits.13.154.

gurmukhi: Pyr kY sB dys mY hY mwirE mK jwie ]
transliteration: Pher Kai Sabh Des Mai Hai Maario Makh Jaae||
translation: Moving it throughout the country, the horse was ultimately killed in the sacrificial place;

gurmukhi: kwit kY iqh ko qbY pl kY krY cqu Bwie ]
transliteration: Kaattee Kai Tih Ko Tabai Pal Kai Darai Chat(u) Bhaae||
translation: Then it was cut into four pieces (parts).

gurmukhi: eyk ib`pRn eyk CqRn eyk iesqRin dIn ]
transliteration: Ek Bippran Ek Chhatran Ek Istran(i) Deen||
translation: One part was given to the Brahmins, one to Kshatriyas and one to women.

gurmukhi: cqR AMs bicE ju qwN qy hom mY vih kIn ]14]155]
transliteration: Chatra Ans Bachio Ju Taan Te Hom Mai Vah(i) Keen||14||155||
translation: The remaining fourth part was burnt in the fire-altar.14.155.

gurmukhi: pMc sY brK pRmwn su rwj kY ieh dIp ]
transliteration: Panch Sai Barakh Pramaan Su Raaj Kai Eh Deep||
translation: After ruling this Dvipa for five hundred years.

gurmukhi: AMq jwie igrY rswql pMf puqR mhIp ]
transliteration: Ant Jaae Girai Rasaatal Pand Poutra Maheep||
translation: These sons of king Pandu ultimately fell in the himalayas (neither-world).
